title: Rediscovering The Joy of Analog Creation
preview: About two years ago now, I spent a lot of time creating things with my hands.

title: Napoleon Hill's Self Analysis Questions
preview: With the end of the insane year that was 2020, I decided to do a Self-Analysis taken straight from Think and Grow Rich! by Napoleon Hill. It gives you a really great self-examination that you can refer to year over year to qualitatively measure improvement. More context is provided in the book's Epilogue.

title: What Digital Minimalism Means to me as a Software Developer
preview: I'm coming to the end of reading Digital Minimalism and it felt only fitting to accompany my learnings with a blog post. I have quite a few thoughts about Digital Minimalism as a whole, but I want to focus in on framing it in the perspective of my identity as a Software Developer, and as someone who has been exposed to and supported by tech all her life.

title: Github Gems: Mos
preview: Whenever I'm looking for a particular software to help me do something, I always look to the most advertised and popular option that shows up in my Google search results first.

title: A Productivity Marathon
preview: This week, I've been struggling a lot with managing my productivity system. It pains me to think about how much time I've spent on... tangibly nothing. But I like to believe that if nothing else, I'm feeding my soul and I'd really like to think that I'm taking steps towards developing something that truly works for me.

title: Things I Wish I Knew When I Started as a Software Developer
preview: Soon after settling into my first job out of university, I realized that software development is not at all the same as Computer Science. The skills you develop learning Computer Science are sure to help you with development, but are not a necessary prerequisite to do well in it.

title: How to Plan Your Goals Using Scrum
subtitle: Tech Translation
preview: The goal of this post is to give you an idea for a structured way to organize your goals using concepts borrowed from software development processes.

title: Re-learning the Value of Money
subtitle: Frugality as a Hindrance
preview: I thought of it as scarce, as the most prized commodity. In turn, leading me to not being as generous as I could have been, quite frugal in the moments where it could potentially hinder my relationships with people, wasting tons of time on negligible money-related decisions, and in general turning me into a person I didn't like when it came to the topic of money.
